bibl.note: This is a letter from William L. Lovely, an agent to the Cherokees, to David Henley, dated March 4, 1801. Lovely writes about giving farm supplies to the upper town Cherokee. He also mentions Glass, a Chickamauga Cherokee.

div.p: I forgot to mention to you that great application is made for Cotton Cards for the use of the upper Town Indians - ploughs hoes &c etcetera __

The Glass has wrote me respecting- the Mill Stones being brought down to the look out Mountain where the Mill is errecting erecting the means of transporting them youll please to advise_ Taught I think had better come up and assist if you think it proper I will send him word for that purpose_
